summary: The text discusses amendments to various laws related to economic rights, publication, and banking operations in Nepal. It highlights the establishment of provisions for regulating banking activities and the definition of negotiable instruments. The amendments aim to align Nepalese laws with the constitution and enhance the legal framework for economic activities. The text also mentions the initiation of amendments to strengthen and update existing laws, such as the Banking and Negotiable Instruments Act.

summary: The text discusses the provisions of the Financial Management Act, 2081, which regulates the allocation and management of funds from the Federal Savings Fund for the fiscal year 2081/82. It outlines the authority to allocate and spend funds, as well as the role of the Office of the Auditor General in overseeing the financial management. The Act also specifies the procedures for budgeting and transferring funds as per Schedule 2.

summary: The Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Act, 2074 has been amended by the Amendment Act, 2075 to coordinate all activities related to disaster management in a comprehensive and effective manner. It aims to reduce the impact of natural disasters on public, private, and individual properties, as well as protect natural and cultural heritage. The Act also establishes a National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Committee to oversee disaster management at the national level.

summary: The text discusses the Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Regulations, 2076 published in the Nepal Gazette. It outlines the provisions and responsibilities related to disaster risk reduction and management. The regulations were amended in 2081 to align with the Disaster Risk Reduction Act, 2074. The regulations emphasize coordination among various levels of government and organizations for effective disaster management. Specialized committees are formed to address specific areas of expertise in disaster management.

summary: The text discusses the regulations related to the control of epidemics in Nepal, with amendments made in 2024, 2028, and 2070. It outlines the roles and responsibilities of various officials such as supervisors, caretakers, and volunteers in implementing epidemic control measures. The regulations also specify the requirements for certification, vaccination standards, and the division of areas for epidemic control programs. The government is empowered to appoint superintendents for each area as needed.
